other_tests.findings: In the descending colon, there is a 10 cm segment of asymmetric wall thickening and inflammatory change, centered around a diverticulum, consistent with perforation. A small amount of extraluminal air and extraluminal fluid indicate focal perforation. The fluid collection measures 1.1 x 1.5 x 2.6 cm. At the interpolar region of the left kidney, there is a 2.1 cm hypodensity with intermediate attenuation characteristics. No hydronephrosis or renal stone is noted.
